instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
I am working on a late 2012 Macbook Pro a1425 I have the following with the board removed from the system and only the dc board attached.

Green light and then amber after a few seconds which means the PPV3v42 is working.

I measure the following
CHGR_DCIN = 16.5V
PPBUS_G3H = 1.3v
PPDCIN_G3H = 16.5V
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR = 16.5V

R7020 + R7021 + R7022 = 10.03 ohms

CHGR_LGATE = switched output 
CHGR_UGATE = switched output

looking for suggestions on where to go next.

Thanks.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: Also there is no Fan spin

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
Is that 820-3462 board?

"R7020 + R7021 + R7022 = 10.03 ohms"
Is that reading between pins 27/28 of ISL6259?
Post value for 17/18 too.

Also check voltage for some pins of U7000, 2, 3, 12, 13, 19, 20, 9, 15.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
I'm not sure where to find the 820 number,  the board has 2 fans.

yes on the 10.03 ohms

reading between pins 17/18 on isl6259 = 10.44 ohms

readings on pins

2 = 16.25
3 = 3.95
12 = 3.41
13 = 3.37
19 = 5.48
20 = 5.49

9,15  I can't locate another place on the board to get readings on this and I don't have a probe small enough to get those.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: 8.8 ohms measured at r6905 to ground with power disconnected.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
You didn't specify which pin of R6905.
Remove F7040 and see where the short remains.

"17/18 on isl6259 = 10.44 ohms"
You must get aprox 3 ohms there.

"yes on the 10.03 ohms"
And aprox 20 here; no idea how you measure on the board.

Take readings on the C7020/50 directly.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: You?re like measuring 17/18 and 27/28 improperly but we?ll worry about that soon. Remove F7040 and see if the short is on pin 1 or pin 2

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
the measurement for PPBUS_G3H was taken from pin 1 of R6905

This measurement 
 "R7020 + R7021 + R7022 = 10.03 ohms"  was taken from pin 1 of R7021 to pin 1 of R7022 with the resistors in series 10 ohms + .02 ohms + 10 ohms = 10.02 ohms so my 10.03 ohms reading seems to be in tolerance.

"17/18 on isl6259 = 10.44 ohms"  this was take from pin 1 of R7051 to pin 1 of r7052   the schematic shows R7051 as 2.2 ohms + R7050 .01 + R7052 as 0 (??) =  2.21 ohms   I am reading 10.44 on a second reading of that I'm showing 10.63 now.

I will remove F7040 and check for the short and report back.

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
"10 ohms + .02 ohms + 10 ohms = 10.02 ohms"
Really NOT; 20.02 ohms if you want be so exact.
With a reading of aprox 20 ohms is OK.

"17/18 on isl6259 = 10.44 ohms"
Now measure R7051/52 separatelly and change the one with higher value.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
ha yea your right, what was I thinking?

what temp do you guys use for these boards to remove, I had mine set to 380c and was able to remove some components from a test board but this fuse doesn't seem to want to come loose?

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: I rechecked the reading at R7020 + R7021 + R7022 = 20.02    not sure what I did before.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
Add first leaded solder on its terminals...

Temp adjust depend by every hot air station.
I use Mlink H1 at 475 degrees and 5 air flow.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
Thanks the leaded solder did the trick!
R7051 + R7052 + R7050 =  3.3 OHMS now

short to ground now appears on pin 2 of the fuse F7040

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
measurement from pin 1 of R6905 to ground is 8.9 ohms  pin 2 of R6905 to ground is 18.9 ohms

from the schematic I have there isn't anything between pin 2 of F7040 and pin 1 of R6905

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
Nothing more than the same name, =PPBUS_G3H; what do you think this mean?
Impossible to draw all the connections in the same page for a mainboard...

So you have aprox 9 ohms on PPBUS_G3H, which is main power rail.
Check now for a similar value on the big coils (secondary supplies).
If you get same value on any, check then resistance between that coil and PPBUS_G3H. A reading close to 0 ohm will mean the high-side MOSFET of respective power supply is shorted.
Do NOT inject tension into PPBUS_G3H before check all of them.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
I removed F9700  and short remains
I had also removed R6905 I'm not sure If I had said that in the last post.

Checked the following  TO PPBUS_G3H

L7030 P1 448.2 ohms
L7220 P1 2.93 k ohms
L7550 P1 12.3 ohms
L7560 P1 12.3 ohms
L7510 P1 14.5 ohms
L7520 P1 14.5 ohms
L7630 P1 25.2 ohms

I attached the power supply and I am now getting 12v at pin 1 of F4070 while its removed.

I guess the next suggestion will be to inject power and see what heats up?

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
"I removed F9700"
???

"I guess the next suggestion will be to inject power and see what heats up?"
My next suggestion is to read again the previous post; but REALLY read it!

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: If the short is on pin 2 of the fuse, it could be several things. Inject voltage at pin 2 start low around 1 volt to make sure it is not the CPU. Commonly, large caps can cause your short.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
Do NOT inject tension before you check what I mentioned before.
NEVER ever inject voltage on the main power rail before discard a shorted high-side MOSFET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
I had removed F9700 before your post I was just letting you know what I did.

these were the measurements from the coils to ground

Reading to ground

L7030 = changing in the mega ohms
L7510 = 5.6 ohms
L7520 = 5.6 ohms
L7550 = 3.3 ohms
L7560 = 3.3 ohms
L7630 = 16 ohms

after that I measured the following to PPBUS_G3H since these were closer to 0 ohms

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: Check resistance between pin 2 of the fuse and L7510.

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message: pin2 of fuse to p1 of L7510 is 14.4 ohms

threads.title: Macbook Pro a1425 logic board
threads.message:
You have more coils to check, look schematic from page 57 to 63.
If between PPBUS_G3H and one coil you get the sum of both resistances to ground, that means its high side MOSFET is OK.
Where you will get the difference, then remove its MOSFET and check resistance to ground again.
